Html:
Hi,

I am probably missing something, but when I save the .coffee file it doesn't get compiled and nothing happens.

Steps I've done:

  1. Install the plug-in.
  2. Download the Windows compiler and put it under C:\Tools\coffeescript-compiler
  3. In VS 2010 went to Tools>Options>Chirpy>CoffeeScript and set the compiler to C:\Tools\coffeescript-compiler\coffee.bat
  4. Added a new file to existing MVC3 project: public\js\a.coffee with the following content: "1+1"
  5. Saved it.
  6. Nothing happened :(

I played a bit with different options but I don't even get any Console output from Chirpy.

Could you please suggest what I might be missing?

Cheers,
Dima.

All your steps look good, except the default extension Chirpy looks for is *.chirp.coffee.

Change your a.coffee file to a.chirp.coffee and you should be in business!

Noah

I have same problem here, the only one diference is that I'm using coffee.exe on compiler.

If I open file.js and change and save file.chip.coffee, VS ask me to reload it, but it have no content.

What should I do?
"file.chip.coffee" change to "file.chirp.coffee" or change file extension in configuration screen.

For some reason, I'am having problem to switch from the default (dll build-in) CoffeeScript compiler to custom one. Even filled an issue on this: http://chirpy.codeplex.com/workitem/95


The source code for the default compiler is in Chirpy dll and I can not fine the source code for the library to recompile.
